Classic Counter Strike single player campaign.

Další pokračování dnes už ikonické střílečky, která byla dlouhou dobou fenoménem v multiplayeru. Pokud jste nikdy neslyšeli o Counter-Striku, tak snad a k nehrajete hry. 

Ovšem tento díl se nám trochu liší. Od původní verze 1.1 a 1.6 se CSCZ liší tím, že se dá hrát i jako singleplayer. Ano k u předchozích verzí jste mohli trénovat s Boty, ale tady to funguje trochu jinak.

Zde máte hru rozdělenou na mise. Každá z nich má jisté úkoly, které když splníte, tak si odemknete další mapu. Musím uznat, že zrovna tohle se mi líbí. Je to příjemná změna, pokud chcete trénovat v různých mapách a s různými zbraněmi.

Obtížnosti si můžete volit, stejně jako si můžete volit svůj tým. Díky tomu máte i různorodost při opakujících se úkolech. No tady je kámen úrazu. Nebo spíše začínají zápory hry.

Mínusy:
1. Dnes už lidl grafika.
2. Málo inovací oproti CS 1.1
3. Boti jsou dost hloupí i při nejtěžší obtížnosti.
4. Hra nemá ten správný feeling na singleplayer.

Plusy:
1. Arzenál zbraní. 
2. Možnost plnit mise u sp.
3. Možnost výběru svého týmu.
4. Multiplayer

No a jdeme na konečné hodnocení. Rozhodně doporučuji. Jedná se o velmi povedenou střílečku, kterou budete chtít hrát s přáteli. Osobně se mi tento díl líbil víc, jak CS: Source. Ale na výběr tu je ještě i CS: GO, které disponuje hlavně lepší grafikou.

Hodnocení:
70%

За сингъла - Динамична и забавна кампания, на "Експерт" ботовете в по-горните нива са си предизвикателство, тъй като аймът им е с 90-99 процента точност, на някои мапове се озорих докато ги мина. Голям минус обаче за "AI"-то на 2-ките.  На последните 3 карти и по-конкретно "Piranesi", сте шестима 2-ки срещу осем 1-ци. Или повечето кампят на А докато всички "Т" плантват на Б. Или, когато "Т" плантнат бомба на Б, пак всички 2-ки отиват до А, един след друг.Независимо къде се намират на картата и дори, когато някои от съотборниците съобщи по радиото, че зоната е чиста, което от своя страна води до това, че да поведеш с 2 врътки 1-ците, за да минеш картата, може наистина да те изкара извън нерви.

This game is a bit weird. I've never been a fan of Counter Strike, but I do enjoy playing against bots. The progression of objectives with increasingly difficult enemies and smarter team mates is interesting as a game play loop. Perhaps this game is best for those new to Counter Strike as a whole and want to understand the game mechanics more before jumping into 1.6, Source, or Global Offensive.

It's the second Counter-Strike, it's lost quite a lot of popularity over the years, since now everyone plays CS:GO and forget about the old ones. This one is a little bit different, it's a singleplayer Counter-Strike with the attachment of multiplayer, this is what makes me enjoy the game.

It's got a team selection system as well, you have points, you start with few and work your way up, your team members have different levels of skill. Most of them have different levels of Bravery, Co-op and Skill. Your team members will start with a low level of skill, and as you get further into the game, their skill levels will grow higher.

I'd give the game a 8.14/10, because it's singleplayer, and it's old.

Можно отдать должное разработчикам «Контры», но они создали игру, которая совершенно нетребовательна к системным ресурсам ПК. Ведь, чтобы играть в counter-strike не нужен крутой компьютер с мощными видеокартой и процессором. А вот конечно на мониторе экономить не следует, cs 1.6 требует постоянного внимания (⌒_⌒;)

The case with [i]Counter-Strike: Condition Zero[/i] and the deleted scenes portion of it is that it offers semi-valuable content, but it is baffling as to why [i]Valve[/i] thought it warranted a separate release.

I am very conflicted on this release, as I find value in the single-player missions present in the base game and even some bit of enjoyment in the campaign added in [i]Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes[/i], but as many have complained about during the launch of this version of the original, there isn't enough content here to warrant a separate price tag, and arguably a lot of what they added here should have been present in the original [i]Counter-Strike[/i] release, or added as a free update. Instead, [i]Valve[/i] released this three-and-a-half years after the original's debut, and failed to add enough substance to make up for this confusing and seemingly money-grabbing release. There isn't much here the original doesn't have, and what it does have either isn't worth the money or should have been in the previous installment initially. Valve seemingly backed off on this release after they realized the negative feedback and ratings far below their expectation, but in abandoning this project, much of what could have been improved was instead left in mediocrity, and so this game never got the redemption it could of had.

Although it doesn't have a coherent campaign in the base game, the eighteen provided missions separate from one another are actually not too bad of quality, I found myself enjoying them personally, and they also helped me hone my skills initially before going online and facing other players in the other games. This and this alone is a great part of the release here, but again this is really all there is good that [i]Counter-Strike[/i] doesn't have. The campaign in [i]Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes[/i] is not very good, or should I say it lacks a certain quality and motivation to keep the player interested, which makes the value of this drop even further down. This single-player campaign is not what [i]Counter-Strike[/i] is known for, and it shows us just how bad taking the focus away from multiplayer really can be. Since this game often comes bundled with the original, if you do decide to purchase it, you may as well take advantage of practicing on a few single-player missions, but besides that, this release will likely end up useless to most, and therefore is not worth the money.

[i]Counter-Strike: Condition Zero[/i] is a very confusing mess of a release that not only adds little to nothing new to the player, but came out years later and still had almost nothing to show for the time spent in development. Unless you are an avid fan or think you will find some value in playing through this, it would be best to skip out on this installment.

[b][RATING: 5.6/10][/b]
